DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate safety performance new version coronary artery stent treat blockage artery supply blood heart muscle . The Amaranth Medical MAGNITUDE scaffold release drug ( sirolimus ) reduce likelihood treat blood vessel develop new blockage . In addition , scaffold dissolve away time , leave permanent implant blood vessel heal .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Study Amaranth Medical MAGNITUDE Bioresorbable Drug-Eluting Coronary Stent ( RENASCENT III )
DOC.detailed_description: The objective study evaluate safety performance AmM MAGNITUDE Bioresorbable Drug-Eluting Coronary Scaffold use treatment two different de novo native coronary artery lesion patient undergo elective percutaneous coronary intervention . The scaffold single-use device comprise balloon-expandable , intracoronary drug coat scaffold pre-mounted rapid-exchange delivery catheter . The scaffold make Poly-L-Lactide ( PLLA ) coat polymer-antiproliferative drug ( sirolimus ) matrix . The scaffold provide mechanical support similar metallic stent vessel healing , gradually breaks time leave permanent implant treat vessel . Compared prior version scaffold , new device thinner strut design ( wall thickness 100 µm rather 120 µm 150 µm ) , otherwise identical . The study design prospective , non-randomized , multi-center , non-inferiority trial . It enroll maximum 70 patient 20 investigational center Colombia European Union . Eligible patient least 18 year age diagnose symptomatic ischemic disease due two different , de novo , stenotic lesion native coronary artery ask participate study . After treatment investigational device , subject follow five year . Safety device evaluate use incidence target vessel failure follow-up period . Performance ( efficacy ) assess use in-scaffold late lumen loss measure quantitative coronary angiography nine month .
DOC.criteria: General 1 . Subject ≥ 18 year age < 85 year age . 2 . Subject agree participate investigational device drug study period two year follow index procedure . Questionnairebased study , study noninvasive require investigational device medication allow . 3 . Subject ( legally authorize representative ) provide write informed consent prior studyrelated procedure , use form approve local Ethics Committee . 4 . Subject : 1. evidence myocardial ischemia ( e.g. , stable angina [ Canadian Cardiovascular Society 1 , 2 , 3 , 4 ] unstable angina [ Braunwald Class 13 , BC ] , silent ischemia support image study [ ETT , SPECT , stress echocardiography , Cardiac CT ] ) , 2. low intermediate risk NSTEMI , 3. evidence myocardial ischemia coronary territory previously affect STEMI long lesion fulfills angiographic inclusion criterion intervention perform ≥ 3 month follow STEMI . 5 . Subject acceptable candidate coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) surgery . 6 . Patient agree complete protocol require followup visit , include angiogram . Angiographic 1 . Patient indicate elective stenting two de novo native coronary artery lesion . 2 . If two lesion treat , must either locate two separate epicardial vessel ( side branch consider separate vessel ) locate within single epicardial vessel separate ≥ 15 mm angiographically normal vessel . 3 . If elective percutaneous intervention two different lesion plan , one follow situation must apply : 1 . If lesion suitable stenting MAGNITUDE™ scaffold , lesion treat procedure . In case stag strategy choose , minimum period stag intervention require . In either strategy , distal lesion must intend treat first proximal lesion . 2 . If one lesion intend treat litmusbased metallic DES second lesion study lesion ( e.g. , suitable stenting MAGNITUDE™ scaffold ) , two lesion must locate two different epicardial vessel ( side branch consider separate vessel ) . Both lesion treat procedure . In case stag strategy choose , minimum period stag intervention require . However , follow condition must apply : Nonstudy lesion must successfully treat without clinically significant complication prior treatment study lesion . Nonstudy lesion must ≤ 30 mm length . Reference vessel diameter nonstudy lesion must ≥ 2.75 mm QCA . Nonstudy lesion involve leave main stenting , bifurcation stenting , chronic total occlusion , high thrombotic burden . 4 . Each study lesion ( e.g. , suitable stenting MAGNITUDE™ scaffold ) must measure ≤ 14 mm length online QCA . 5 . Each study lesion ( e.g. , suitable stenting MAGNITUDE™ scaffold ) must locate native coronary artery diameter ( average distal proximal lesion IVUS ) 2.5 mm 3.5 mm . 6 . Each study lesion ( e.g. , suitable stenting MAGNITUDE™ scaffold ) must major artery/branch visually estimate diameter stenosis ≥ 50 % < 100 % Thrombolysis Myocardial Infarction ( TIMI ) flow ≥ 1 . General 1 . Patient known hypersensitivity contraindication aspirin , heparin bivalirudin , antiplatelet medication specify use study ( clopidogrel , prasugrel , ticagrelor ) , sirolimus derivative , poly ( Llactide ) , poly ( D , Llactide ) , platinumiridium , contrast sensitivity adequately premedicated . 2 . Patient evolve ST segment elevation myocardial infarction ( STEMI ) . 3 . Patient current unstable arrhythmia . 4 . Patient leave ventricular ejection fraction ( LVEF ) < 30 % . 5 . Patient receive heart transplant organ transplant , wait list organ transplant . 6 . Patient previous stent placement ≤ 15 mm ( proximal distal ) study lesion ( ) ( e.g. , suitable stenting MAGNITUDE™ scaffold ) . 7 . Patient receive schedule receive chemotherapy malignancy ≤ 30 day prior index procedure . 8 . Patient receive immunosuppressant therapy and/or know immunosuppressive autoimmune disease ( e.g . human immunodeficiency virus , systemic lupus erythematosus , rheumatoid arthritis , severe asthma require immunosuppressive medication , etc. ) . 9 . Patient receive schedule receive chronic anticoagulation therapy ( e.g. , heparin , Coumadin ) stop restart accord local hospital standard procedure . 10 . Elective surgery plan ≤ 9 month index procedure require discontinuation antiplatelet medication . 11 . Patient platelet count < 100,000 cells/mm^3 > 700,000 cells/mm^3 , WBC < 3,000 cells/mm^3 , document suspect liver disease ( include laboratory evidence hepatitis ) . 12 . Patient known renal insufficiency ( e.g. , eGFR < 60 ml/kg/m^2 serum creatinine level > 2.5 mg/dL , subject dialysis ) . 13 . Patient history bleed diathesis coagulopathy refuse blood transfusion . 14 . Patient cerebrovascular accident ( CVA ) transient ischemic neurological attack ( TIA ) ≤ 6 month prior index procedure . 15 . Patient significant GI urinary bleed ≤ 6 month prior index procedure . 16 . Patient extensive peripheral vessel disease preclude safe introducer sheath insertion . 17 . Patient receive brachytherapy epicardial vessel ( include side branch ) . 18 . Pregnant nursing subject plan pregnancy ≤ 2 year follow index procedure . ( Note : Subjects childbearing potential must negative pregnancy test ≤ 28 day prior index procedure agree use contraception 2 year . ) 19 . Patient medical illness ( e.g. , cancer congestive heart failure ) know history substance abuse ( alcohol , cocaine , heroin , etc . ) per physician judgment may cause noncompliance protocol confound data interpretation associate life expectancy ≤ 1 year . 20 . Subject belongs vulnerable population ( e.g. , subordinate hospital staff , mentally deficient , unable read write ) . Angiographic Exclusion 1 . A study lesion ( e.g. , suitable stenting MAGNITUDE™ scaffold ) meet follow criterion : 1 . Aortoostial location ( within ≤ 3 mm aorta junction ) . 2 . Left Main location . 3 . Located ≤ 3 mm origin leave anterior descending ( LAD ) leave coronary circumflex ( LCX ) . 4 . Located within arterial saphenous vein graft distal diseased ( defined vessel irregularity per angiogram > 20 % stenosed lesion , visual estimation ) arterial saphenous vein graft . 5 . Lesion involve bifurcation > 2 mm diameter ostial lesion > 40 % stenosed visual estimation side branch require predilatation . 6 . Total occlusion ( TIMI flow 0 ) prior wire crossing . 7 . Excessive tortuosity ( ≥ two 45° angle ) , extreme angulation ( ≥ 90° ) proximal within target lesion . 8 . Restenotic previous intervention . 9 . Moderate severe superficial calcification ( defined calcium arch > 120° ) proximal within target lesion . 2 . A study lesion ( e.g. , suitable stenting MAGNITUDE™ scaffold ) involve myocardial bridge . 3 . A study vessel ( e.g. , lesion suitable stenting MAGNITUDE™ scaffold ) contain visible thrombus indicate angiographic image . 4 . Another clinically significant lesion locate major epicardial vessel ( ) ( include side branch ) study lesion ( e.g. , suitable stenting MAGNITUDE™ scaffold ) . 5 . Inadequate predilation ( residual stenosis > 40 % visual assessment ) study lesion ( e.g. , suitable stenting MAGNITUDE™ scaffold ) . 6 . Patient high probability use ancillary device ( e.g. , atherectomy cut balloon ) require time index procedure treatment study vessel ( e.g. , lesion suitable stenting MAGNITUDE™ scaffold ) .
